results.title: Measure metric: length 1: who measures?
results.brief_description: Two teenage boys explore metric measurement in downtown Toronto. Demonstrates proper length-measuring technqiues, using the appropriate measurement instrument, and learning the linea equivalents of 1m, 10cm, 1000cm. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.
results.description: Two teenage boys explore metric measurement in downtown Toronto. Demonstrates proper length-measuring technqiues, using the appropriate measurement instrument, and learning the linea equivalents of 1m, 10cm, 1000cm. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Measure metric. Vol. 3. Doc Cranshaw and the kid: the winner
results.brief_description:
The grandson of a medicine man wins a contest by mastering metric volume measurement. Demonstrates the use of formula, the relationship and the principle of water displacement to determine the volume of non-rectangular objects.
Suitable for middle and upper primary level.

results.title: Measure metric. Vol. 2. Doc Cranshaw and the kid: the contest
results.brief_description:
Demonstrates metric measurement of volume, using litres, millilitres, cubic centimetres and cubic decimetres. Includes a variety of processes for determining the volume of a rectangular solid.
Suitable for middle and upper primary level.

results.title: Measure metric. Vol. 1. Doc Cranshaw and the kid: the medicine show
results.brief_description:
A medicine man and his grandson learn about metric measurement from residents of a Utah frontier town. Demonstrates the litre and the millilitre and methods for determining the volume of liquid and granular substances.
Suitable for middle and upper primary level.

results.title: Measure length
results.brief_description: Two boys who explore their neighbourhood with a metre stick and a centimetre rule discover the comparative size of things around them. Explains the importance of measuring length and defines the standard metric unit.
results.description: Two boys who explore their neighbourhood with a metre stick and a centimetre rule discover the comparative size of things around them. Explains the importance of measuring length and defines the standard metric unit.

results.title: Measure for measure (BBC)
results.creator_credit: BBC, Cedric Messina and Desmond Davis
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Television Shakespeare Series”.
After deputising Angelo to enforce Vienna’s long ignored laws, Duke Vincentio purports to leave the city but actually remains to observe the proceedings, disguised as Friar Lodowick. Angelo revives an old statute against fornication and sentences Claudio to death for seducing Juliet, his betrothed. However, when Claudio’s sister Isabella, a religious novice, pleads for his life, her beauty so inflames Angelo’s own passions that he is very willing to ignore the law, promising her brother’s freedom if she yields to him. Vincentio, advises Isabella to pretend to cede to Angelo’s wishes. Once Vincentio reveals his true identity Angelo is severely castigated and ordered to marry Mariana to whom he was formerly betrothed.

results.title: MEART
results.brief_description: Located at the School of Anatomy and Human Biology, University of Western Australia. The SymbioticA Research Group (Sarg) has collaborated with the Laboratory for Neuroengineering at Georgia Tech in the US for the last 3 years. The collective is: Oran Catts, Research Director; Ionat Zurr, New Media; Guy Ben-Ary, Biological Artist; Phil Gamblin, Artist; Dr Stuart Bunt, Founder & Scientific Director.

results.title: Meantime
results.brief_description: Meantime is a sympathetic film about unemployment and the jobless. The film is built around the life of a family living in a council flat in the East End of London. Frank, Mavis, Colin and Mark are the four central characters - Frank, Colin and Mark are all unemployed - and the family live a tense, precarious existence in their cramped high-rise flat.
